data.question: What is the SO2 uptake capacity of Zr-bptc at 0.1 bar and 298 K?
Which MOF shows the highest SO2 uptake at 273 K and 1.0 bar?
Does the introduction of amine groups into the pores of UiO-66 enhance SO2 uptake at low concentrations?
What is the role of atomically-dispersed CuII sites in SO2 adsorption?
data.answer: They enhance the capture of SO2 at low concentrations.

data.question: Is the SO2 adsorption in Zr-MOFs reversible?
What is the BET surface area of MFM-422?
Can the captured SO2 in Zr-bptc be converted to valuable products?
What is the selectivity of Zr-bptc for SO2/CO2 at 298 K?
Does UiO-66-CuII show a reduction in CO2 uptake at 0.15 bar and 298 K compared to UiO-66?
What is the impact of introducing functional groups into Zr-MOFs on SO2 adsorption?
data.answer: It enhances low pressure SO2 uptake.

data.question: What is the SO2 uptake of Zr-DMTDC at 298 K and 1 bar?
Is the SO2 uptake capacity of UiO-66 affected by the introduction of open CuII sites?
What is the main advantage of reversible SO2 adsorption in MOFs?
data.answer: It allows for regeneration of the sorbent for use over many cycles.

data.question: Does Zr-bptc show a higher SO2 uptake at low concentration compared to other Zr-MOFs?
What is the thermal stability limit of MFM-422?
Can the captured SO2 in Zr-bptc be quantitatively converted to aryl N-aminosulfonamide?
What is the role of in situ X-ray diffraction in the study of SO2 adsorption in MOFs?
data.answer: It enables the visualization of the binding domains of adsorbed SO2 molecules.

data.question: Is the SO2 uptake of UiO-66-NH2 at 1 bar higher than that of UiO-66?
What is the significance of the BET surface area in the context of MOFs and gas adsorption?
data.answer: It is an indicator of the material's porosity and potential for gas adsorption.

data.question: Does the presence of thienothiophene groups in Zr-DMTDC contribute to its SO2 adsorption capacity?
